definitions.definition: based on new ideas, forms or methods that are used to find out what effect they have

examples.text: The school's experimental teaching methods include letting the children decide what to study.
The equipment is still at the experimental stage.
Doctors stress that this kind of treatment is still experimental.
These techniques are still highly experimental.
Actors and audience worked together to create three pieces of experimental theatre.

wordOrigin: late 15th cent. (in the sense ‘having personal experience’, also ‘experienced, observed’): from medieval Latin experimentalis, from Latin experimentum, from experiri ‘try’.
